intro: Scelochilus bigibbosus, commonly known as the two-lobed scelochilus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Scelochilus bigibbosus is adapted to arid conditions and has a deep root system to access moisture.
